title: logo design critique
content:
Best all,

We designed this new agency identity in the Chevin.  
We are happy about the spacing, but we would like to hear some point from you guy’s  
I would like to have the identy rock solid.

best b

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013111013im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/mattmo_logo_5110.jpg)

 [‹ Portfolio by e-mail](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013111013/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45210 "Go to previous forum topic") [Last word on a recto ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013111013/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45331 "Go to next forum topic")
author: base

comments.content: Base, I can’t see the attachment(s).
sorry i put a jpegon, so you should be able to see it?

Base,

I would let the both “T” go together and form a “ligature”. Too much space between them both as it is now. Another option would be to shorten the inner part of both “T” if you want the letters to be separated. Tighten about 25-30%. Secondly I would also tighten up the kerning on the pay-off about 20-30% and som extra on the space between “brand” and value. It might just be the picture, but to me the vertical stroke seems too thin to my eyes. Good luck.
thanks stefan, i will look at the kerning of the payoff thanks fot the point on the t’s

Base,

You’re welcome! I usually edit the letters when doing logo work. That way the end result becomes more unique, rather than just  
having the normal letters side by side...

Cheers
you need to upload RGB JPGs on the web. CMYK won’t render in a lot of browsers.
